alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Harrison; Pearl River (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 3:25PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Harrison, northeastern Hancock and east central Pearl River Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 325 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles north of Kiln, or 15 miles north of Diamondhead, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Harrison, northeastern Hancock and east central Pearl River Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
